definition: to put on a hat/to be first/to dub
the brightest jewel in the crown
pinyin: huang2 guan1 shang4 de5 ming2 zhu1
Huang2 guan1 Jia4 ri4 Jiu3 dian4
Huang2 guan1 Chu1 ban3 Ji2 tuan2

sentences.english: Ensure compliance to Crowne Plaza Keys mandatories and implementation of new standards.
sentences.chinese: 確保編輯皇冠假日主要條款並執行新標準。

sentences.english: Here at Moviefone, we promote a safe work environment.
sentences.chinese: 在拍皇冠網址時，我們創造一個安全的工作環境。

sentences.english: Sunspear stayed loyal to my father when the Usurper stole his throne.
sentences.chinese: 太陽矛在篡權者偷了我父親的皇冠後一直對他忠誠。

sentences.english: The king is wearing a crown .
The boy collects her leaf and makes them into crown, he dresses up the King of the forest.
sentences.chinese: 收集她的葉子，把葉子編成皇冠，扮起森林裏的國王。

sentences.english: Prior to this appointment, she was the Director of Sales at Crowne Plaza Shanghai Fudan.
sentences.chinese: 履新前，她是上海復旦皇冠假日酒店的銷售總監。

sentences.english: It wasn't always clear the statue's crown would one day re-open, either.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，我們也不清楚女神的皇冠是否會開放。

sentences.english: It is the right choice for every domestic beverage factory.
sentences.chinese: 是國內各飲料廠清洗皇冠蓋玻璃瓶的理想選擇。

sentences.english: A good health body is worth more a crown in gold.
sentences.chinese: 健康的身體比金皇冠更有價值。

sentences.english: Crowne Plaza Shanghai New Wing had opened.
sentences.chinese: 上海銀星皇冠假日酒店新翼已開業迎客。

sentences.english: quietude is the crown of life.
Her hair is a burning corona, her eyes are white-hot flakes .
sentences.chinese: 他的頭髮如燃燒的皇冠，他的眼中放射出白熾的火花。

sentences.english: It matched well with the crown on her head and the bow on her left ears.
sentences.chinese: 這與她頭上的皇冠，左耳朵上的蝴蝶結很相配。

sentences.english: One can intend to know by reading through the crown like Mila.
sentences.chinese: 你可以意願通過皇冠頂輪來明白，就象Mila一樣。

sentences.english: I worked in Grand royal hotel as a bellboy.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經在嘉逸皇冠酒店做過前臺行李生。

sentences.english: It matched well with the crown on her head and the bow on her left ear.
sentences.chinese: 這與她頭上的皇冠，左耳朵上的蝴蝶結很相配。

definition: laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
to inlay/to embed/to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring)/tiling/tesselation
